description:
Mammotome associates know that every moment matters when it comes to advancing breast cancer diagnostics and surgical solutions. When you come to work at Mammotome, you’re collaborating with a global team of engineers, designers, communicators, strategists, and specialists to improve patient outcomes. If you want to be inspired to grow every day, join our diverse, hardworking, high-performing team.

Be part of a company that’s a trusted leader in breast cancer diagnostics and support products you can feel passionate about!

Mammotome is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Sr. Sales Training Manager for Mammotome is responsible for designing and delivering sales training curricula and learning materials, to educate the Mammotome sales force on key selling techniques. The role requires creativity and passion to lead the strategic selling direction of our product portfolio and assist with sales representative development both in the field and through corporate training events.

This position is part of the Sales Department located in Cincinnati and will be hybrid. At Mammotome, our passion is driving innovative technologies that create efficiencies, while never forgetting that at the heart of every breast cancer journey is a patient.

You will be a part of the Sales Organization and report to the VP of Sales. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to work to build a world-class sales training organization—read on.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

Design and develop sales specific training curricula and framework for Mammotome products including but not limited to content around strategic & conceptual selling, negotiation, account management, and other best practices.

Facilitate & lead the planning & agenda development for the National Sales Meeting, as well as any selling workshops for medical conferences, new product rollouts and/or at Mammotome’s in-house training facility

Establish a process for evaluating the effectiveness of sales training activities including supervision and improvements of the existing clinical training program

Develop and implement a standardized sales training & evaluation process for new hires in the field in partnership with Regional Training Specialists (RTS) Team

Schedule Sales training activities by working closely with the Clinical Sales Training Manager, Sales Leaders, guest physicians, and other presenters to schedule sales training activities

Manages the administration and effectiveness of leadership programs such as the Regional Training Specialist and Management Development programs to ensure consistency in training needs with a clear, structured pathway for Sales Rep career development

The essential requirements of the job include:

6+ years of sales training experience with 3+ years of experience in content and curriculum development with a command of adult-learning/training principles

Proven experience delivering all levels of sales training using multiple learning platforms (i.e., instructor led, online, self-study, etc.)

Ability to identifying selling skill gaps (including but not limited to product knowledge, sales call effectiveness, opening and closing skills) and appropriate training strategies and curricula to minimize Representative gaps

Experience with Miller-Heiman and/or other strategic selling frameworks

It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:

2+ of sales leadership/training experience as a top sales performer with a track record of proven success within the Medical Devices, and/or Diagnostics industry. IDN experience preferred

Both capital equipment and disposable medical device sales experience strongly preferred

At Mammotome we believe in designing a better, more sustainable workforce. We recognize the benefits of flexible, hybrid working arrangements for eligible roles and are committed to providing enriching careers, no matter the work arrangement. This position is eligible for a hybrid work arrangement in which you can work part-time at the Company location identified above and part-time remotely from your home. Additional information about this hybrid work arrangement will be provided by your interview team. Explore the flexibility and challenge that working for Mammotome can provide.

The salary range for this role is $150,000 - $165,000. This is the range that we in good faith believe is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.

This job is also eligible for bonus/incentive pay.

We offer comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

#LI-Hybrid

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out.
